content.title: Scheme for Establishment of Hi-Tech and Mini Dairy Units
content.details: The scheme 'Scheme for Establishment of Hi-Tech and Mini Dairy Units' is implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of Haryana. This is a credit-linked scheme with a primary objective of providing self-employment opportunities. The unemployed persons will be assisted by way of providing financial assistance in the form of subsidies for establishing dairy units of 4, 10, 20, and 50 milch animals like buffaloes, indigenous cows (Hariana, Sahiwal, Belahi, Red Sindhi, Tharparkar, and Gir breeds only) and crossbred cows.
benefits: 25% subsidy on the cost of milch animals for dairy units of 4 and 10 milch animals
Interest subvention on 75% cost of milch animals for dairy units of 20 and 50 milch animals
eligibility: Applicant should be 18 to 55 years of age and a resident of Haryana
No mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements
Applicant should have space/shed for keeping milch animals
Self-Declaration for being unemployed is required
Specific land requirements for units with 20 and 50 milch animals
exclusions: Any group/firm/organization will not be permitted to apply under the Scheme
documents_required: Copy of Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque
Photo of Availability of shed/space for keeping animals

faqs.question: Who is implementing this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: What types of dairy units can be established under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Dairy units with 4, 10, 20, and 50 milch animals, including buffaloes, indigenous cows, and crossbred cows.

faqs.question: What are the medium-term objectives of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide gainful self-employment, supplement the income of beneficiaries' families, raise the socio-economic status of weaker sections, and commercialize dairy units.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is provided for dairy units of 4 and 10 milch animals?
faqs.answer: A 25% subsidy on the cost of milch animals for loans availed for purchasing these animals.

faqs.question: How can eligible applicants apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants must apply online through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
